subject: Re: Greetings to you my Dear,
body:
Hello Mrs Michelle, how are you doing?we are waiting to hear from you soon
regarding your transaction, so we can proceed with the legal procedures.

Thanks
Mr Goodluck

On Tuesday, February 6, 2024, Michelle <jd05550@***.com> wrote:
>
>
>
> Dear Mr. Goodluck Dominic,
>
> Thank you for your prompt response and for taking the matter seriously. I
am relieved to hear that you have identified Mrs Mary Ann's claim as false.
>
> I am ready to comply with all necessary procedures to secure my funds.
However, I would appreciate if you could provide more details about the
next steps and how I should proceed with the payment of USD.
>
> Looking forward to hearing from you soon.
>
> Best wishes,
> Michelle
>
>
>
>
>

subject: Greetings to you my Dear,
body:
Hello Michelle, how are you doing I have waiting to hear from you regarding
this transaction as I ask you to reconfirm to me all your banking details
to enable us transfer the funds to you once you send the required fee which
is the processing and transfer charges worth $200 USD only.

You can transfer the fee via western union office in your city with below
information to enable us proceed and complete this transaction asap.

Receiver first Name: ANDY
Surname: OBI

Receiver Country: Benin Republic.
City: Cotonou.

Address:BP 021 Porto Novo-Benin Republic.

Amount to send:$200 USD Only.

Please once you send the payment kindly forward the payment receipt and
don't forget to send me Mtcn and senders Name.

Finally you will receive your total after this payment and please try and
reconfirm your banking information and address so that we can make
everything done instantly.

Note the lady who claim to be your next of kin is now in jail so do the
necessary thing to receive your funds soon.

Warm Regards
Mr Goodluck Dominic.

subject: Re: Greetings to you my Dear,
body:
Hello Dear Michelle I hope you receive the payment instructions giving to
you, so get back to me soon.

On Friday, February 2, 2024, Michelle <jd05550@***.com> wrote:
>
>
>
> Dear Mr. Goodluck Dominic,
>
> I am surprised to hear about Mrs. Mary Ann's claim. I have not authorized
anyone to act on my behalf regarding this matter. I am not suffering from
any serious sickness and I am fully capable of handling my own affairs.
>
> Please do not proceed with any transactions involving Mrs. Mary Ann or
anyone else claiming to represent me without my explicit consent.
>
> Thank you for bringing this matter to my attention.
>
> Best wishes,
> Michelle
>
>
>
>
>

subject: Re: Greetings to you my Dear,
body:
Hello Michelle what is going on I want to remind you that we have already
sort out with the lady who claims to be your next of kin and she is in
prison now.

So try and get in touch with me asap regarding your transaction because
everything is ready for the processing of your funds and once you make the
payment we will complete everything immediately.

Finally we are looking forward to hear back from you soon.

Mr Goodluck Dominic.

subject: Re: Greetings to you my Dear,
body:
Are you sure that you still want this funds because we are ready to cancel
the transfer if you don't need the funds any more so get back to me now.

On Wednesday, March 6, 2024, Jane Vernon <janaewiegand446@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hello Dr. Johnson Una,
>
> Thank you for getting back to me. I appreciate you providing the details
for the Ria transfer or Money Gram. I will proceed with the payment as soon
as possible.
>
> However, I seem to have encountered a little issue. I tried to send the
payment using the details you provided, but the transaction didn't go
through. Is there any chance you could verify the details again for me? I
really want to get this sorted out quickly so that my transfer can be
completed as soon as possible.
>
> Looking forward to your assistance in resolving this matter.
>
> Best regards,
> Jane Vernon
>
